page.title: 20OUR VILLAGE
page.content: ON THE 5/9/84 WE WENT FOR A WALK.IT WAS VERY INTERESTING.A HOUSE WE CAME ACROSS SHOWS THAT IT USED TO BE A THATCHED ROOFIT HAS BRICKS HIGHER THAN THE TILED ROOF AND A VERY HIGH CHIMNEY NUMBER 11 MAIN STREET HAS 3 S ON THE WALL ALSO WE HAVE IN OUR VILLAGE A POST BOX WITH V,R IT STANDS FOR VICTORIA REGINA.TOP END FARM IS 250 YEARS OLD ABOUT 1700. STONE HOUSE WAS MADE IN 1773. THE BAKER HOUSE BEDROOM FLOOR IS MADE OF CONCRETE. ON SUNDAYS PEOPLE USED TO BRING THEIR RAW DINNERS TO BE COOKED AT THE BAKE HOUSE AND ASKED THE MAN TO COOK THE MEAT. ABOUT 3 HOURS LATER THEY CAME BACK WITH A POT AND THE MEAT WOULD BE COOKED IN TIME. THEY WOULD PAY HIM 2 OLD PENNIES. WRITTEN BY VICTORIA JONES , KATIE 'O'NEILL ,DEBBIE WHITE ,PIERS TANNER.
